description: Manage frontend ports of an application gateway.

commands.name: az network application-gateway frontend-port create
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway frontend-port create --gateway-name
                                                    --name
                                                    --resource-group
                                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                    [--port]
examples: az network application-gateway frontend-port create -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway -n MyFrontendPort --port 8080

commands.name: az network application-gateway frontend-port delete
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway frontend-port delete --gateway-name
                                                    --name
                                                    --resource-group
                                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network application-gateway frontend-port delete -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway -n MyFrontendPort

commands.name: az network application-gateway frontend-port list
examples: az network application-gateway frontend-port list -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway

commands.name: az network application-gateway frontend-port show
commands.summary: Get the details of a frontend port.
examples: az network application-gateway frontend-port show -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway -n MyFrontendPort

commands.name: az network application-gateway frontend-port update
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway frontend-port update --gateway-name
                                                    --name
                                                    --resource-group
                                                    [--add]
                                                    [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                    [--port]
                                                    [--remove]
                                                    [--set]
examples: az network application-gateway frontend-port update -g MyResourceGroup --gateway-name MyAppGateway -n MyFrontendPort --port 8081

commands.name: az network application-gateway frontend-port wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
